KS2 & 11+ Maths Tuition

Building unshakeable confidence for SATs and 11+ Entrance Exams.

Check Availability View Curriculum
THE REALITY

Why students struggle at this level.

  • The 'Word Problem' Wall: Students who can do sums but freeze when asked a written question.
  • 11+ Pressure: The anxiety of entrance exams for Grammar or Private schools.
  • Slow mental maths (e.g., struggling with times tables) holding them back.
  • Boredom in class leading to a belief that 'maths is dull/hard'.
The GG Method

How we secure the top grades.

  • Gamified Learning: We turn drills into challenges. If they enjoy the lesson, they retain the information.
  • 11+ Non-Verbal Logic: We teach the specific pattern-spotting skills required for GL and CEM assessments.
  • Visualising Fractions: Using pizza slices, bars, and blocks to make abstract concepts like '3/4 of 20' obvious.
  • Word Problem Translation: Teaching kids how to highlight keywords and translate English sentences into maths sums.
Secure your KS2 & 11+ Maths Grade

More Than Just Tutoring

A holistic approach designed for high performance.

Positive Reinforcement

At this age, confidence is fragile. We celebrate every small win to build a 'growth mindset', proving to them that practice makes progress.

The 11+ Roadmap

Entrance exams require speed. We gently introduce timed conditions so that on the big day, the ticking clock isn't scary—it's normal.

Concrete to Abstract

We don't just write numbers. We draw diagrams and use physical examples. Once they 'see' the maths, the method sticks forever.

Common Questions

When should we start 11+ preparation?

We recommend starting in Year 4 or very early Year 5. This allows us to cover the syllabus gently without the 'cramming' panic that causes stress.

Do you teach Non-Verbal Reasoning?

Yes. NVR is a huge part of the 11+ (GL and CEM). We teach specific techniques to rotate shapes and spot patterns in your head.

My child gets bored easily. How do you keep them engaged?

Our KS2 sessions are shorter-paced and interactive. We switch topics frequently and use screen-sharing tools to let the student 'write' on the board.

Do you help with SATs?

Yes. While many parents focus on the 11+, we also ensure students are ready for their Year 6 SATs, ensuring they leave primary school with a 'High Standard' score.
